item.title: Ticket #6072 (Write Post: Permalink should not be "undefined" if I click Edit, clear ...) created
item.dc:creator: lloydbudd
item.description:
Write Post: Permalink should not be "undefined" if I click Edit, clear the field, and then click Save

ENV: WP trunk r7133 (2.5-beta1)

The result is Permalink: ​http://example.com/undefined/ [Edit]

But it doesn't actually save any change thankfully.

The expectation is that a new permalink is created based on the current post title.

ADDITIONAL DETAIL

Specifically, after publishing a post. I decide I want to change the title, and I want the URL to be updated as well. That is where my expectation comes from, and previous versions of WP worked in this manner.

item.title: Ticket #6062 (Dashboard - Problem with international characters at plugins feed) updated
item.dc:creator: lloydbudd
item.description:
I just noticed a similar problem with a comma incoding from Google for Incoming links, and that patch didn't seem to fix it.

My incoming links is ​http://blogsearch.google.com/blogsearch_feeds?hl=en&scoring=d&ie=utf-8&num=10&output=rss&partner=wordpress&q=link:http://foolswisdom.com/

The item is:

gracefulflavor linked here saying, "In a word, yes. I’ve written before about how I� ..."

item.title: Ticket #4977 (JQuery 1.1.4 incompatible with interface.js) updated
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
Replying to darkdragon:

Probably can switch over to jQuery UI for dragging and Dropping, but Interface.js is still being used in the latest version with jQuery 1.2.3. Need to confirm that issue is still a problem with Safari.

The last time I checked, UI's drag and dropping were extremely buggy. Even the demos on the UI site don't work.

if ( !empty($curl) && '<' != $curl{0} && $next ) { // If it isn't a tag

Should be used instead.

item.title: Ticket #6071 (register_sidebars should allow name to be an array) updated
item.dc:creator: AaronCampbell
item.description: Well, there was a problem in the diff AND in the description. I fixed the diff, and the register_sidebars call should look like this: register_sidebars(2, array('name'=>array('left','right')));

item.title: wordpress-widgets.diff attached to Ticket #6071
item.dc:creator: AaronCampbell
item.description: Fix for register_sidebars

item.title: Ticket #6071 (register_sidebars should allow name to be an array) created
item.dc:creator: AaronCampbell
item.description: register_sidebars allows you to give a name with a %d in it, but you can't register multiple sidebars with unique names. It seems like you should be able to pass an array of names to be used, like this: register_sidebars(array('name'=>array('left','right'))); Which would create two sidebars, one named left, and one named right.

item.dc:creator: Martin2006
item.description: As get_avatar places $size inside an attribute, it should be sanitized before being written to the page to avoid XSS injection or any injection to the remote server (gravatar).

item.title: Ticket #6068 (permalink shown on edit page page incorrect for sub-pages) created
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
The permalink shown on the "edit page" page does not show correctly for sub-pages.

Eg, I've got a page, with the parent "WordPress Plugins"(slug: wordpress-plugins), the permalink shown is: 

Permalink: http://dd32.id.au/remove-max-width/ Edit

While in reality, it exists at: 

http://dd32.id.au/wordpress-plugins/remove-max-width/

(Note that the "View this page" link does point to the right location.

item.title: Ticket #6067 (Which plugins are activated isn't clear enough) created
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
The gray text vs. black text is a really horrid way to indicate which plugins are activated. The color difference is very slight and on some monitors, would be impossible to tell the difference.

I highly suggest using a different method of indicating a plugin is activated -- perhaps going to a light blue / dark blue background like the green in previous versions.

item.title: Ticket #6066 (Import Links menu entry missing) created
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
Just installed WP trunk (rev 7128), and found that under Manage, there is no easy way to get to Import Links.

The only link I could find to wp-admin/link-import.php was under the Related section when editing an already existing link. Kinda hidden.

It's going to be a bit cluttered and awkward adding an "Import Links" item under the Manage menu. It wasn't so bad before, when the blogroll had its own top-level menu.

item.title: Ticket #6065 (use native line-endings where possible) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description:
Here are the files, which don't have eol-style = native: 

 M     wp-includes/js/jquery/jquery.color.js
 M     wp-includes/js/jquery/jquery.js
 M     wp-includes/js/jquery/jquery.form.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/wp-scriptaculous.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/prototype.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/builder.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/sound.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/MIT-LICENSE
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/effects.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/unittest.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/scriptaculous.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/dragdrop.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/slider.js
 M     wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/controls.js
 M     wp-includes/js/crop/cropper.css
 M     wp-includes/js/tinymce/license.txt
 M     wp-includes/js/tinymce/plugins/autosave/readme.txt
 M     wp-includes/js/tinymce/langs/wp-langs.php
 M     wp-content/themes/default/rtl.css
 M     wp-config-sample.php
 M     wp-admin/includes/dashboard.php
 M     wp-admin/js/custom-fields.js
 M     wp-admin/js/categories.js
 M     wp-admin/js/users.js
 M     wp-admin/css/widgets-rtl.css

Of these, wp-config-sample.php (which already is), wp-includes/js/tinymce/license.txt, wp-includes/js/tinymce/plugins/autosave/readme.txt, wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/MIT-LICENSE whould stay CLRF, because there is a chance they will be abused by notepaders.

Also, there are few more files, which should be CLRF-ed: license.txt and wp-includes/images/crystal/license.txt.

This process could be turned into a routine: 

cd /path/to/wp/clean/trunk
EXCLUDES="license.txt wp-config-sample.php wp-includes/js/tinymce/license.txt wp-includes/js/tinymce/plugins/autosave/readme.txt wp-includes/js/scriptaculous/MIT-LICENSE license.txt wp-includes/images/crystal/license.txt"
svn propset -R svn:eol-style native *
for f in $EXCLUDES; do svn revert $f; done

item.title: Ticket #5759 (Dashboard fails to load when Widgets are disabled) updated

item.description: Maybe Widgets shouldn't be allowed to be disabled anymore.

item.title: Ticket #4060 (Custom Header Support in Default Theme) updated
item.dc:creator: spikeyslam
item.description: Are color fades necessary? Don't most users who use Custom Image Header, upload their own images? It should be one or the other and not both at the same time. Custom Image Header should trump color fade if used.

item.title: Ticket #6056 (Fatal error: Only variables can be passed by reference in ...) updated
item.dc:creator: darkdragon
item.description:
That is fascinating. That code is basically: 

$current = array_keys($tabs)[0];

It is too bad, but maybe more lobbying can be made to allow for the above code to function in PHP.

item.title: Ticket #5586 (One click plugin updates) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
+ $fs->setDefaultPermissions( $fs->getchmod($tmppath) ); + $fs->mkdir($tmppath, 0755);

I noticed that in [7126], Is 0755 the best for the folder? It neads read/write for owner, read for group/everyone.

Which according to ​http://www.ezau.com/latest/tools/chmod.html would be 0644 which is what i'd more expect.

item.title: Ticket #6056 (Fatal error: Only variables can be passed by reference in ...) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
Some info on it: ​http://the-stickman.com/web-development/php/php-505-fatal-error-only-variables-can-be-passed-by-reference/

For reference, This would be valid and would work (Because its saved to a variable first..) 

$current = array_shift( $keys = array_keys($tabs) );

item.title: Ticket #6056 (Fatal error: Only variables can be passed by reference in ...) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
Must be a bug in 5.0.5.. That combination is mentioned on the php.net site.

I wish my host would upgrade to the more stable 5.2 :)

item.title: Ticket #6061 (Dashboard - Box too small at secondary feed) updated
item.dc:creator: Nightgunner5
item.description:
Keywords changed

I can confirm the patch on (all Windows) Safari, Opera, Firefox, and IE 7 (it shows all four of the widgets vertically, but I don't think my patch did that).

On IE 6, the entire page disappeared and only the header, the "Right Now" box, and the footer were displayed. I don't think my patch did that either.

item.title: Ticket #4601 (Add extra formatting parameters to wp_list_categories) updated
item.dc:creator: thee17
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: Ticket #4601 (Add extra formatting parameters to wp_list_categories) updated
item.dc:creator: thee17
item.description:
If I could just figure out how to work around the li and ul problem like bookmarks does it then $style could be sent to pasture.

Line 289 

$output = '';
	if ( $title_li && 'list' == $style )
			$output = '<li class="categories">' . $r['title_li'] . '<ul>';

Line 314 

	if ( $title_li && 'list' == $style )
		$output .= '</ul></li>';

item.dc:creator: thee17
item.description: adds $before $after $link_before and $link_after

item.title: Ticket #5886 (Widgets' Cancel links don't really work) updated
item.dc:creator: bryan868
item.description:
I'd like to recommend doing away with the overall "Save Changes" button and give the individual widget buttons 'global control.' So when you remove a widget, it's really gone; or when you make changes to a widget, they automatically stick.

This will allow us to navigate multiple sidebars more quickly, without having to hit the "Save Changes" button every single time.

item.title: Ticket #6053 ("Saved at [time]" status box still appears in edit post even after ...) created
item.dc:creator: lloydbudd
item.description:
"Saved at [time]" status box still appears in edit post even after published

ENV: WP trunk r7117

I publish a post and then go back in and edit it. I tell some text and then wait a minute and the "Saved at [time]" status box appears.

As expected, autosave is disabled for published posts. So this status box is erroneous.

item.title: Ticket #6045 (Flash Uploader Issues on Shared account (dealing with Flash on OS X)) closed
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
wontfix:

I worked directly with the reporter today. On his shared account with a forwarded domain, the uploader sends a well-formed POST to the correct URL. The response is a 301 (Moved Permanently) to the same URL plus a trailing slash (async-upload.php/). This much happens regardless of platform.

In Windows, the Flash uploader succeeds. In OS X, it fails and gives the user the HTTP Error. We modified async-upload.php to dump $_POST as a first line and this was not caught by the uploader, so it looks like the 301 is not coming from the script.

This is an extreme edge case and no solution presents itself. A possible workaround is to add an option to disable Flash uploads.

I have passed the information upstream to ​http://swfupload.org/forum/generaldiscussion/275 and linked back here.

item.title: Ticket #5790 (Confirm Deletion on Manage Pages) closed
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
duplicate:

No longer an issue with the new design.

[5370]

item.title: Ticket #5370 (No confirmation on deleting posts in Manage, Posts) closed
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
invalid:

It was a valid issue - but no longer. The new design doesn't have any delete actions for single posts, pages, links, categories, tags, or link categories.

We only have one-off delete actions for comments, and I think the consensus for comments is to not have AYS.

item.title: Ticket #5886 (Widgets' Cancel links don't really work) updated

item.description:
Status changed

I'll work on this soon.

I think this is a release blocker, but not a beta blocker.

item.title: Ticket #6034 (error class in wp-admin needs restyling) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Error message Add User.png

Shows error message and .form-invalid highlights (pink rows).

How does the .form-invalid color look?

The error message is not full width. #ajax-resonse should probably have no padding or margins globally since it's an empty element on all pages 95% of the time. Also, the margins for .error are tuned for when it's at the top of the screen, which is not always the case.

[7103/trunk/wp-admin/wp-admin.css] is what I did for the recent post edit collision ajax messages that show up underneath the post box. (Here, #autosave is like #ajax-response.)

Note - we can rename the #ajax-response on the add users page to anything we want. It'll require a JS tweak is all.
